title: Job Openings at RNP Services
content:
RNP Services is an HR Services company for corporate bodies and individual.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Male Cook (Live in) 

Job Location: Kabosa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Cook/prepare all local meal and few continental
	To assist in menu preparation
	Keep the kitchen clean at all time
	Good menu planner
	Great in hygiene etc.


Benefits
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Cook - N160,000 monthly
	Live in - Accommodation available
	HMO, pension, leave allowance, 13th salary.


Application Closing Date: 15th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: rnpconsultingng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Cleaner / Laundry Assistant (Live in)

Job Location: Kabosa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Laundry related role
	Washing/Ironing
	Cleaning and tidying up the environment
	Applicants must live in Abuja.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO / OND qualification with 2 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary


	N90,000 - N100,000 per month. 


Benefits:


	HMO, Pension, Leave allowance, 13th salary
	Live in - accommodation available.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: rnpconsultingng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Female Cook / Steward (Live in) 

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Responsibilities


	Cooking - local dishes
	Keeping the apartment clean
	Market runs etc.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO / NCE / OND qualification with 2 - 4 years of work experience. 


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 7th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: rnpconsultingng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Male Kitchen Assistant (Live in)

Job Location: Kabosa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage the kitchen
	Assist in food preparation
	Keep the kitchen clean at all time
	Procurement - Market runs.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO / OND qualification with 2 - 4 years of work experience. 
	Applicants must live in Abuja.


Benefits


	Salary: N120,000 monthly.
	HMO, Pension, leave allowance and 13th salary.
	Accommodation available.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: rnpconsultingng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Virgin-landmarts
content:
Virgin-landmarts is a Nigerian real estate company headquartered in Lagos. Established to solve the dearth in global housing ownership as well adding value to individual and organization on a timely and consistent basis.

Our core business include Real Estate, Building construction with modern architectural design and property management. We are a team of highly skilled professionals, trained and equipped with the necessary tools to distinguish ourselves in the Real Estate industry.

We are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Create detailed journal entries and post them to the general ledger (GL) to track all income statements and expenses
	Handle all accounts payable and receivable on a daily basis to make sure each invoice and expense report is accurate
	Reconcile all business accounts to ensure records match up and no transaction gets lost
	Enter financial data into computer software, making sure all bills and invoices are filed correctly
	Facilitate all incoming payments and outgoing cheque including printing, obtaining signatures for, and distributing cheque as necessary
	Follow up with vendors for accounts payable and keep in touch as needed for collections and ensure bills are paid on time
	Prepare quarterly report using standard best practices and assist in monthly closings
	Assist the team or other staff with accounting duties as needed.


Requirements


	High School Diploma required, a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field is highly valued
	3 -5 years of relevant experience in human resources.
	Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field.
	Accounting background added advantage
	Experience & Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
	Proficient in excel usage
	Solid written and verbal communication skills is a must
	Must be a Female.


Other Requirements:


	Interested Candidates must reside in Lagos preferably within this key region (Festac Town, Mile 2, Satellite Town, Ojo Town, Igando, Abule-Ado and environs).


Remuneration
Attractive Salary.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@virginlandmarts.com.ng using the Job Position in CAPITAL LETTER as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Customer Care Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The candidate will act as a liaison, provide product/services information, answer questions, and resolve any emerging problems tour customer accounts might face with accuracy and efficiency.


Responsibilities


	Manage walk-in customer, incoming phone calls and customer complaints
	Generate sales lead
	Build sustainable relationships and trust with customer accounts
	Meet customer service team sales targets.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree or HND in Mass Communication, Business Administration, Public Administration, Marketing etc
	Good communication and writing skill s knowledge of computer and added advantage
	Must be a Female
	Keep records of customer interactions etc.


Other Requirements:


	Interested Candidates must reside in Lagos preferably within this key region (Festac Town, Mile 2, Satellite Town, Ojo Town, Igando, Abule-Ado and environs).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@virginlandmarts.com.ng using the Job Position in CAPITAL LETTER as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The right candidates will be responsible for generating leads and meeting sales goals.


Responsibilities


	Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands company’s customer base and ensure it’s strong position in the market place.
	Generate sale lead
	Negotiating all contracts with prospective clients.,Prepare weekly and monthly reports.
	Promote , Sale the brand products and services.
	Attend to client inquiry on brand , products, prices, etc
	Meet the brand monthly set target.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or Public Relations
	Experience in sales with 2-3 years of experience an added advantage.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Both Gender can apply


Other Requirements:


	Interested Candidates must reside in Lagos preferably within this key region (Festac Town, Mile 2, Satellite Town, Ojo Town, Igando, Abule-Ado and environs).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@virginlandmarts.com.ng using the Job Posiiton in CAPITAL LETTER as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Manager",
  "description": "Mactay Consulting is the leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning &amp; Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager &ndash; FTTX
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecoms

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead the end-to-end execution of FTTX (Fiber-to-the-X) and Home Connection projects.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring on-time delivery, cost control, quality assurance, and successful project acceptance while effectively managing teams and maintaining strong client relationships.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee the end-to-end delivery of FTTX projects, ensuring project timelines, quality standards, budgets, materials, and deliverables are met.
	Lead team planning, formation, and management, ensuring optimal resource allocation and performance.
	Drive effective communication and collaboration among cross-functional teams, vendors, and stakeholders.
	Monitor project risks, implement mitigation strategies, and resolve challenges to maintain smooth execution.
	Maintain and expand client relationships, ensuring high customer satisfaction and continuous business growth.
	Prepare and present project reports, progress updates, and final acceptance documentation.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Proven experience in FTTX and Home Connection project execution, with a strong track record of successful delivery.
	Strong background in team management, leadership, and performance monitoring.
	Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	Professional working proficiency in English (both written and spoken).
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to manage clients and stakeholders effectively.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@mactay.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Project Manager Job at Mactay Consulting




        
    

        
        Mactay Consulting is the leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning & Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager – FTTX
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecoms

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead the end-to-end execution of FTTX (Fiber-to-the-X) and Home Connection projects.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring on-time delivery, cost control, quality assurance, and successful project acceptance while effectively managing teams and maintaining strong client relationships.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee the end-to-end delivery of FTTX projects, ensuring project timelines, quality standards, budgets, materials, and deliverables are met.
	Lead team planning, formation, and management, ensuring optimal resource allocation and performance.
	Drive effective communication and collaboration among cross-functional teams, vendors, and stakeholders.
	Monitor project risks, implement mitigation strategies, and resolve challenges to maintain smooth execution.
	Maintain and expand client relationships, ensuring high customer satisfaction and continuous business growth.
	Prepare and present project reports, progress updates, and final acceptance documentation.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Proven experience in FTTX and Home Connection project execution, with a strong track record of successful delivery.
	Strong background in team management, leadership, and performance monitoring.
	Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	Professional working proficiency in English (both written and spoken).
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to manage clients and stakeholders effectively.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@mactay.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Java Developer",
  "description": "Mahshell Soft Limited - We believe in making life easier using technology&nbsp;ensuring a sustained competitive advantage across diverse markets.&nbsp;From creating bespoke software and e-commerce platforms to executing strategic digital marketing campaigns and providing insightful business consultancy, we bridge the gap between your needs and the latest tech advancements.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Java Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Description


	Mahshell Soft Limited is building Bluecounts, a next-generation SaaS platform for SMEs, offering Invoicing, POS, Inventory, Procurement, and Expense Management. We are seeking Senior Java Developers to help us scale this vision.
	If you are passionate about building world-class systems, join us in redefining SME software with Bluecounts.


Your Role &amp; Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices using Java (Spring Boot).
	Implement secure and efficient APIs to connect front-end and mobile apps.
	Optimize database structures (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB) for performance and reliability.
	Collaborate with product, UI/UX, and DevOps teams to ensure seamless system delivery.
	Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with strong emphasis on best practices.
	Contribute to system design and architecture decisions for high-availability SaaS.
	Ensure security, authentication (OAuth/JWT), and compliance within core services.
	Mentor junior developers and participate in code reviews.
	Troubleshoot production issues, ensuring reliability and uptime.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation with potential for growth.
	Opportunity to work on a high-impact SaaS platform serving thousands of SMEs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;work@mahshellsoft.com&nbsp;using &quot;Senior Java Developer Role&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Senior Java Developer Job at Mahshell Soft Limited




        
    

        
        Mahshell Soft Limited - We believe in making life easier using technology ensuring a sustained competitive advantage across diverse markets. From creating bespoke software and e-commerce platforms to executing strategic digital marketing campaigns and providing insightful business consultancy, we bridge the gap between your needs and the latest tech advancements.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Java Developer

Job Location: Lagos

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Mahshell Soft Limited is building Bluecounts, a next-generation SaaS platform for SMEs, offering Invoicing, POS, Inventory, Procurement, and Expense Management. We are seeking Senior Java Developers to help us scale this vision.
	If you are passionate about building world-class systems, join us in redefining SME software with Bluecounts.


Your Role & Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices using Java (Spring Boot).
	Implement secure and efficient APIs to connect front-end and mobile apps.
	Optimize database structures (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB) for performance and reliability.
	Collaborate with product, UI/UX, and DevOps teams to ensure seamless system delivery.
	Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with strong emphasis on best practices.
	Contribute to system design and architecture decisions for high-availability SaaS.
	Ensure security, authentication (OAuth/JWT), and compliance within core services.
	Mentor junior developers and participate in code reviews.
	Troubleshoot production issues, ensuring reliability and uptime.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation with potential for growth.
	Opportunity to work on a high-impact SaaS platform serving thousands of SMEs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: work@mahshellsoft.com using "Senior Java Developer Role" as the subject of the email.
